result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Bail on deposit to be applied towards costs, fees and surcharges.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharges.

If revoked, court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/ earnings.

*Court set restitution at zero.*
Maintain employment of 20 hours per week. If not employed at least 20 hours per week be enrolled fulltime in school.

No driving without a valid license.
No contact with the victim. No contact with the following co-actors: Tameca Bryant, T.H. dob 9/14/97, Q.G. dob 7/14/00, M.L. dob 8/30/99, with the exception of T.Q. dob 11/04/98.
AODA Assessments and comply with recommended treatment or counseling.

timeConds.notes:
Court ordered 90 days of condition time be imposed but STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.
*11/30/2017 to serve 90 days. Straight time.  No good time credit.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachery Thomas Slaten

PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed with the plea and request an adjourned sentencing date. State placed negotiations on the record. Email correspondence with read-in charges received and filed. Plea hearing proceeded. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

15RM038187  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08-14-2015
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in custody.  
James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Return on warrant.  Hearing proceeded.  Bail argument made by defense and the state.  The Court orders bail in the amount of $500.00 CASH with turn over to JusticePoint for Supervision.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2500.00 signature bond) gj

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of James W. Frisch  for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel would not waive her client's appearance and requested another date after rotation.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Defendant remains in remand status as bail defense counsel would not address same today.  Return on warrant scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 7/19/15.  Bench Warrant filed.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20 on 7/21/2015.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared on behalf of James Frisch for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary Report, received and filed.  Message left for Attorney V. Taylor to contact the court for the purpose of scheduling bail/bond hearing (to be held this week).
JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (missed telephone contact 6-23-15), received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant arrived late (at 10:19 a.m.).  Defense counsel requested a plea date.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel's request for another scheduling date was granted by the Court.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial REport dated 5/15/15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Anfrene H

Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Zachery Thomas Slaten in custody.   Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
